title: Can't remove unreachable servers from Outline Manager
description: Hey y'all :) My Outline Manager is currently in a weird state: - There are 2 unreachable servers (GCP, not Digital Ocean) in the Manager. - Their icons on the left sidebar keep spinning. - At first, clicking each icon shows the usual "Connections" and "Settings" tabs but with null/0/blank metrics. - Clicking the "remove server" menu item from the 3 dot menu doesn't do anything. - Eventually, I see this "Server unreachable" page (screenshot attached). - Clicking the "Remove Server" button doesn't do anything. I got into this state because I was experimenting with starting my own Outline server on GCP. When I restarted the GCE instance, the IP changed, and then this "Server unreachable" issue appeared. I re-ran the install script on the instance, added the new IP to Outline Manager, then again shutdown the server and then had a 2nd unreachable server. Outline manager version: 1.8.0 (1.8.0.4401) Thanks!
text_for_topic_modeling: Can't remove unreachable servers from Outline Manager Hey y'all :) My Outline Manager is currently in a weird state: - There are 2 unreachable servers (GCP, not Digital Ocean) in the Manager. - Their icons on the left sidebar keep spinning. - At first, clicking each icon shows the usual "Connections" and "Settings" tabs but with null/0/blank metrics. - Clicking the "remove server" menu item from the 3 dot menu doesn't do anything. - Eventually, I see this "Server unreachable" page (screenshot attached). - Clicking the "Remove Server" button doesn't do anything. I got into this state because I was experimenting with starting my own Outline server on GCP. When I restarted the GCE instance, the IP changed, and then this "Server unreachable" issue appeared. I re-ran the install script on the instance, added the new IP to Outline Manager, then again shutdown the server and then had a 2nd unreachable server. Outline manager version: 1.8.0 (1.8.0.4401) Thanks! source-file source-file source-file source-file

title: Unable to remove existing server in ubuntu
description: After I downsized the vps server in Google Cloud Platform, the existing VPS server IP got changed where the outline server is running. When I went into Outline manager and the item under "Servers" left sidebar where Outline server from Google Cloud Platform shows non-stop spinning icon. After for few seconds, the "Server unreachable" message shows up and I tried to click "REMOVE SERVER" and it didn't work either. ![Server unreachable](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/295096/116792565-77435200-aae7-11eb-9d98-aeb8e2614b50.png) The Outline version number is 1.8.0 and I use Outline-Manager.AppImage to make it app runnable in Ubuntu. I attached both of the screenshots from Ubuntu. ![developer-tool-outline](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/295096/116792570-81fde700-aae7-11eb-9496-3be17f387397.png)

I attached both of the screenshots from Ubuntu. ![developer-tool-outline](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/295096/116792570-81fde700-aae7-11eb-9496-3be17f387397.png) source-file source-file source-file source-file

title: Insufficient number of Xs in template 'outline_logXXX' when installing on Open BSD server
description: When I try to install outline on OpenBSD server I run the following command to install the server:  doas bash -c "$(wget -qO- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Jigsaw-Code/outline-server/master/src/server_manager/install_scripts/install_server.sh)"  and I get the following error:  mktemp: insufficient number of Xs in template `outline_logXXX'

description: qoli@sarayun-gcm:~$ wget -qO- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Jigsaw-Code/outline-server/master/src/server_manager/install_scripts/install_server.sh | sudo bash > Verifying that Docker is installed  OK > Verifying that Docker daemon is running  OK > Creating persistent state dir  OK > Generating secret key  OK > Generating TLS certificate  OK > Generating SHA-256 certificate fingerprint .. OK > Starting Shadowbox  OK > Starting Watchtower  OK > Waiting for Outline server to be healthy  OK > Creating first user  OK > Adding API URL to config  OK > Checking host firewall  BLOCKED Sorry! Something went wrong. If you can't figure this out, please copy and paste all this output into the Outline Manager screen, and send it to us, to see if we can help you.  Checking host firewall  BLOCKED Please show what port need to open. I don't know open which port.

title: Unable to add new server or remove old one
description: I have created a new outline server. That works great. When I open the Manager to add it, the application hangs. Eventually it times out, but I cannot remove the old server, or add a new one. The application just hangs. I have tried uninstalling but this old instance is never removed. It would appear others on Reddit are reporting similar issues. https://www.reddit.com/r/outlinevpn/comments/mqo0g6/i_cannot_remove_the_server_from_outline_manager/ For me this is a show stopper as I cannot release it to the client until I can manage it. I am running MacOS 10.15.7. The Outline Manager version is 1.7.2 (1.7.2.4399).
text_for_topic_modeling: Unable to add new server or remove old one I have created a new outline server. That works great. When I open the Manager to add it, the application hangs. Eventually it times out, but I cannot remove the old server, or add a new one. The application just hangs. I have tried uninstalling but this old instance is never removed. It would appear others on Reddit are reporting similar issues. https://www.reddit.com/r/outlinevpn/comments/mqo0g6/i_cannot_remove_the_server_from_outline_manager/ For me this is a show stopper as I cannot release it to the client until I can manage it. title: Server creation in RTL locales results in mojibake server names
description: ![Screenshot from 2021-06-21 16-57-58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/191945/122827722-ba819c00-d2b2-11eb-912c-b57fea76b43e.png) I expect this is happening because the DigitalOcean droplet "user_data" field is not fully unicode-safe. (The Outline server creation request appears to be well-formed.) It's possible that DigitalOcean is taking the JSON value in UTF-16 and piping it directly to bash, which expects UTF-8.
text_for_topic_modeling: Server creation in RTL locales results in mojibake server names ![Screenshot from 2021-06-21 16-57-58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/191945/122827722-ba819c00-d2b2-11eb-912c-b57fea76b43e.png) I expect this is happening because the DigitalOcean droplet "user_data" field is not fully unicode-safe. (The Outline server creation request appears to be well-formed.) It's possible that DigitalOcean is taking the JSON value in UTF-16 and piping it directly to bash, which expects UTF-8. source-file

title: Generating TLS certificate wrong
description: I try to setup outline on Oracle VPS, but failed I found #405 that point out must install openssl, but openssl is already installed. What should I do? > ubuntu@testvm4:~$ sudo bash -c "$(wget -qO- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Jigsaw-Code/outline-server/master/src/server_manager/install_scripts/install_server.sh)" Verifying that Docker is installed  OK Verifying that Docker daemon is running  OK Creating persistent state dir  OK Generating secret key  OK Generating TLS certificate  Sorry! Something went wrong. If you can't figure this out, please copy and paste all this output into the Outline Manager screen, and send it to us, to see if we can help you. > ubuntu@testvm4:~$ openssl version -a OpenSSL 1.1.1 11 Sep 2018 built on: Wed May 27 19:15:54 2020 UTC platform: debian-amd64 options: bn(64,64) rc4(8x,int) des(int) blowfish(ptr) compiler: gcc -fPIC -pthread -m64 -Wa,--noexecstack -Wall -Wa,--noexecstack -g -O2 -fdebug-prefix-map=/build/openssl-dyPhHZ/openssl-1.1.1=. -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -DOPENSSL_USE_NODELETE -DL_ENDIAN -DOPENSSL_PIC -DOPENSSL_CPUID_OBJ -DOPENSSL_IA32_SSE2 -DOPENSSL_BN_ASM_MONT -DOPENSSL_BN_ASM_MONT5 -DOPENSSL_BN_ASM_GF2m -DSHA1_ASM -DSHA256_ASM -DSHA512_ASM -DKECCAK1600_ASM -DRC4_ASM -DMD5_ASM -DAES_ASM -DVPAES_ASM -DBSAES_ASM -DGHASH_ASM -DECP_NISTZ256_ASM -DX25519_ASM -DPADLOCK_ASM -DPOLY1305_ASM -DNDEBUG -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 OPENSSLDIR: "/usr/lib/ssl" ENGINESDIR: "/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/engines-1.1"

title: Set Watchtower to selectively watch shadowbox
description: I'll admit I should have read the install script a little more carefully, but while running the install, watchtower tried updating all my other containers, which ended up breaking my wordpress container :( I would like to suggest only setting watchtower to selectively watch shadowbox. Reading the watchtower documentation, this can be done by passing in `--label-enable` as a param on watchtower and adding `--label=com.centurylinklabs.watchtower.enable=true` on shadowbox. More information can be found on the [watchtower repo](https://github.com/v2tec/watchtower#selectively-watching-containers)
text_for_topic_modeling: Set Watchtower to selectively watch shadowbox I'll admit I should have read the install script a little more carefully, but while running the install, watchtower tried updating all my other containers, which ended up breaking my wordpress container :( I would like to suggest only setting watchtower to selectively watch shadowbox. Reading the watchtower documentation, this can be done by passing in `--label-enable` as a param on watchtower and adding `--label=com.centurylinklabs.watchtower.enable=true` on shadowbox. More information can be found on the [watchtower repo](https://github.com/v2tec/watchtower#selectively-watching-containers) config-file config-file config-file config-file

title: Connecting to existing Outline server
description: I have an existing Outline server, and I want to add it to the Outline Manager on a different machine. I do not have the initial API information. Where do I get that information from, on the server running Outline? I have tried:  docker exec -it CONTAINERID cat ~/shadowbox/access.txt  But that renders:  cat: can't open '/root/shadowbox/access.txt': No such file or directory  Contents of `/opt/outine/persisted-state` are:  root@shadow:/home/david# docker exec -it CONTAINERID ls -lasFh /opt/outline/persisted-state/ total 32 4 drwxrws 4 root root 4.0K Jan 18 15:50 ./ 4 drwxr-xr-x 3 root root 4.0K Jan 17 22:29 ../ 4 drwxrws 2 root root 4.0K Jan 17 14:28 outline-ss-server/ 4 drwxrws 3 root root 4.0K Jan 17 14:28 prometheus/ 4 -rw-rw 1 root root 1.1K Jan 17 14:27 shadowbox-selfsigned.crt 4 -rw 1 root root 1.7K Jan 17 14:27 shadowbox-selfsigned.key 4 -rw-rw 1 root root 659 Jan 18 15:50 shadowbox_config.json 4 -rw-rw 1 root root 160 Jan 17 22:29 shadowbox_server_config.json  Contents of `~/shadowbox/` are:  root@shadow:/home/david# docker exec -it CONTAINERID ls -lasFh ~/shadowbox total 48 4 drwxr-xr-x 1 root root 4.0K Jan 17 21:26 ./ 4 drwx 1 root root 4.0K Jan 17 21:26 ../ 4 drwxr-xr-x 5 root root 4.0K Jan 17 21:26 app/ 4 drwxr-xr-x 1 root root 4.0K Jan 17 21:26 bin/ 4 drwxr-xr-x 87 root root 4.0K Jan 17 21:26 node_modules/ 4 -rw-rw-r-- 1 root root 712 Jan 17 21:24 package.json 4 drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4.0K Jan 17 21:26 persisted-state/ 20 -rw-rw-r-- 1 root root 17.3K Jan 17 21:26 yarn.lock  Replies to similar issue (#277) do not seem to apply any longer. Again, I do not have the API key, where can I get it from on the container running the Outline server?

title: Puth method in /access-keys needs to use {id} in the path
description: The method to create a key with a specific id operates under `/access-keys/{id}` and not under just `/access-keys` https://github.com/Jigsaw-Code/outline-server/blob/64c4f945342ea7725b936a538f9b39353ee55379/src/shadowbox/server/api.yml#L178 The code is correct but the API docs are not
